column4: you may not be able to write to that file as you are trying than
OR try the same echo command as root.. either or should work for you
is there a way to make mountd/nfs client reread fstab on the fly?
sudo mount -a will remount everything in fstab
but it's not using the new updated options on my NFS shares =(
i read a couple of articles referncing thats a buggy type behaviour or w/e

so was wondering if any other tricks existed.. i updated fstab on 20+ hosts and i know it works fine if i unmount and mount,, but they are in prod and i dont want to do it like that if i dont have to..
sorry don't have a solution for that... good luck.
i was questioning if this would work 'mount -i remount <share>'
